# [Data Preprocessing]{.txtbox_green}

###### Metabolomic data from a real-world experiment comparing diabetic to non-diabetic samples will be loaded and preprocessed for analysis. 

## Load the data

##### Use the [data]{.txbox_green} module to load the example data.
![](../preprocess/imgs/example_data.png){.bordered}

## Prepare the data for analysis

::::: columns 
::: column 
###### Use the [preprocess >> merge]{.txbox_green} module to format the data set and merge with the variable meta data. Select the blue question mark icon at the bottom right to get detailed instructions.

::: 

::: column 
![](../preprocess/imgs/menu.png){.bordered}
:::
:::

::::: columns 
::: column 
###### Add non-numeric variables to the row meta data.

::: 

::: column 
![](../preprocess/imgs/row_meta.png){.bordered}
:::
:::


::::: columns 
::: column 
###### Merge the data index with meta data describing the numeric variables (e.g. KEGG and CID identifiers).

::: 

::: column 
![](../preprocess/imgs/col_meta.png){.bordered}
:::
:::


###### Select calculate and overview the results.
![](../preprocess/imgs/results.png){.bordered}

## Explore and plot.

###### View the dimensions for the created data assets.
![](../preprocess/imgs/dim_plot.png){.bordered}

###### Overview missing values for each sample (row) and variable. Connected lines show missing values for the same sample for multiple variables.
![](../preprocess/imgs/missing_plot.png){.bordered}

## Report
###### Create a report capturing the methods results and figures.
![](../preprocess/imgs/report.png){.bordered}

##### Save the results for later analyses.
![](../preprocess/imgs/saved.png){.bordered}
::::: columns 
::: column 
##### The created sample and variable meta data can be viewed in the [data]{.txbox_green} menu as `dave__row_meta` and `dave__col_meta`, respectively.
::: 

::: column 
![](../preprocess/imgs/saved_data.png){.bordered}
:::
:::




##### From here on every module's analysis will follow the same basic workflow.
